data.title: PFC accepts bids for multiple tenor bonds, bankers say
data.description:
India's Power Finance Corp has accepted bids worth 60 billion rupees ($659.8 million) for bonds maturing in two years and in 10 years, three merchant bankers said on Friday.

The company will pay an annual coupon of 6.96% and 7.31%, respectively, and had invited coupon and commitment bids from bankers and investors for the issues on Friday, they said.

The company did not respond to a Reuters email seeking comment.

data.title: Thailand records current account surplus of $724 million in January
data.description:
Thailand recorded a current account surplus (THCURA=ECI) of $724 million in January, the central bank said on Friday.

  • The economy expanded in January from the previous month but was seen slowing after the end of some stimulus measures, the Bank of Thailand said in a statement.

  • Exports rose 23.6% in January from a year earlier, and imports rose 30.1%.

  • The central bank's private consumption index rose 1.0% in January from December, and the private investment index rose 2.7%.

  • The central bank unexpectedly cut its key interest rate (THCBIR=ECI) on Wednesday to support growth, which is currently expected to be about 2% this year, although Governor Vitai Ratanakorn has said he is aiming for 2.7% growth.

data.title: Pearson meets market expectations with 6% profit rise for 2025
data.description:
British education company Pearson met market expectations with a 6% rise in adjusted operating profit for 2025, as it scaled AI across its products, and said it expected profit to increase by as much as 11%, at the top end of its range, in 2026.

The company on Friday reported profit of 614 million pounds ($830 million) on sales of 3.58 billon pounds for 2025, representing an expansion in its margin to 17.2%.

($1 = 0.7401 pounds)

data.title: UK's Physitrack Q4 revenue falls 8% on divestments
data.description:
Overview

  • UK digital healthcare firm's Q4 revenue fell 8% due to divestments and strategic exits

  • Adjusted EBITDA for Q4 rose 26%, reflecting improved profitability

  • Company maintained positive free cash flow in Q4

Outlook

  • Physitrack focuses on commercial acceleration in North America for 2026

  • Company aims to maintain profitability discipline while accelerating growth

  • Physitrack enters 2026 with strengthened cash generation and high recurring revenue

Result Drivers

  • DIVESTMENTS AND STRATEGIC EXITS - Reported revenue decline attributed to divestments and planned exit of lower-margin activities within Wellness

  • SUBSCRIPTION REVENUE - Subscription revenue represented 92% of group revenue, highlighting strength of recurring SaaS model

  • LIFECARE DIVISION - Lifecare division showed stable ARR growth and strong retention, contributing positively to Q4 results

Company press release:

Key Details

Metric

FY Sales

Beat/Miss

Actual

EUR 13.50 mln

Consensus Estimate

Analyst Coverage

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Physitrack PLC is SEK23.00, about 122.2% above its February 26 closing price of SEK10.35

  • The stock recently traded at 10 times the next 12-month earnings vs. a P/E of 16 three months ago

For questions concerning the data in this report, contact Estimates.Support@lseg.com. For any other questions or feedback, contact reuters.support@thomsonreuters.com.

data.title: Globalworth Real Estate portfolio value edges up, operating profit drops
data.description:
Overview

  • CEE office investor's portfolio value slightly increased by 0.9% to €2.6 bln

  • Net operating income decreased by 4.6% to €137 mln

  • Company maintained strong cash position with €410.6 mln as of year-end

Outlook

  • Company did not provide specific guidance for future quarters or full year

Result Drivers

  • RENOMA PROPERTY - Re-addition of Renoma property after renovation contributed to portfolio footprint increase

  • LEASING ACTIVITY - 141.1k sqm of commercial space leased or extended, with an average WALL of 4.8 years

  • OCCUPANCY DECLINE - Average occupancy decreased to 85.4%, influenced by Renoma's re-inclusion and high base effect in Romania

data.title: REG - Barclays PLC - Transaction in Own Shares
data.description:
RNS Number : 6106U Barclays PLC 27 February 2026  

  • 27 February 2026

    Barclays PLC

    Transaction in own shares

    Barclays PLC (the ''Company'') announces that it has purchased for cancellation the following number of its ordinary shares of 25 pence each on the London Stock Exchange from J.P. Morgan Securities plc (''JPM'') as part of its buy-back announced on 10 February 2026:

    Date of purchase: 26 February 2026

    Number of ordinary shares purchased: 3,185,000

    Highest price paid per share: 474.9000p

    Lowest price paid per share: 466.9500p

    Volume weighted average price paid per share:471.2823p

    The Company intends to cancel all of the purchased ordinary shares.

    Following the cancellation of the repurchased shares, the Company's issued share capital will consist of 13,797,261,131 ordinary shares with voting rights.

    There are no ordinary shares held in Treasury.

    The above figure 13,797,261,131 may be used by shareholders (and others with notification obligations) as the denominator for the calculation by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

    In accordance with Article 5(1)(b) of the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No 596/2014, as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended, a full breakdown of the individual purchases of ordinary shares made by JPM on behalf of the Company

    can be found at:

    http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/6106U_1-2026-2-26.pdf

    Since the commencement of the share buy-back programme announced on 10 February 2026, the Company has purchased 41,431,750 ordinary shares on the London Stock Exchange in aggregate at a volume weighted average price of 470.5603p per ordinary share.

    - ENDS -

    For further information, please contact:

  • Investor Relations

    Media Relations

    Marina Shchukina +44 (0) 20 7116 2526

    Tom Hoskin +44 (0) 20 7116 4755

  • About Barclays

    Our vision is to be the UK-centred leading in global finance. We are a diversified bank with comprehensive UK consumer, corporate and wealth and private banking franchises, a leading investment bank and strong, specialist US consumer bank. Through these five divisions, we are working together for a better financial future for our customers, clients and communities.

    For further information about Barclays, please visit our website home.barclays.

This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact rns@lseg.com or visit www.rns.com.

data.title: Sweden's Peptonic Medical Q4 sales fall, margin improves on restructuring efforts
data.description:
Overview

  • The Swedish medical tech firm's Q4 sales fell yr/yr due to company structure changes

  • Gross margin improved to 67% from 56% yr/yr

  • Company concluded reorganization and signed distribution deals in US, Canada, UK, Mexico

Outlook

  • Peptonic Medical plans geographical expansion to strengthen presence in existing and new markets

  • Company focuses on product development to broaden intimate care offering

  • Peptonic Medical revamps marketing strategy to enhance brand visibility and customer engagement

Result Drivers

  • RESTRUCTURING EFFORTS - Peptonic focused on streamlining operations by closing unprofitable subsidiaries and products, improving gross margins

  • DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENTS - Strategic distribution deals signed in US, Canada, UK, and Mexico to support future growth

  • FOCUS ON INTIMATE CARE - Company emphasized its focus on proprietary portfolio of intimate care products for growth

Company press release:

data.title: Shearwater GeoServices: Q4 2025 saw a 63% revenue jump and improved EBITDA, but the market outlook remains subdued
data.description:
Q4 2025 revenue surged 63% year-over-year to USD 168.9M, driven by strong multi-client sales and improved fleet utilisation. Despite a net loss, EBITDA and cash flow improved, and cost reductions were achieved. The market remains competitive with no near-term recovery expected.

Original document: Shearwater GeoServices Interim report — Feb. 27 2026

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: British engineering firm Senior mulls multiple takeover bids
data.description: Britain's Senior on Friday said the engineering firm had received multiple takeover offers in recent months, and two of which it deems "superior" are being considered, with discussions ongoing with the potential bidder.

data.title: MRO: Strong 2025 results with double-digit profit growth and robust 2026 outlook
data.description:
2025 saw 8% revenue and 23% operating profit growth, with strong Engines and Defence performance, £125m free cash flow, and margin expansion. 2026 guidance targets further double-digit growth, higher margins, and increased shareholder returns.

Original document: Melrose Industries PLC [MRO] Slides Release — Feb. 27 2026

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: MRO: Strong revenue and profit growth, positive cash flow, and robust 2026 outlook
data.description:
Revenue grew 8% and adjusted operating profit rose 23% year-over-year, with strong performance in both Engines and Airframes. Free cash flow turned positive at £125 million, and a new share buyback and dividend increase were announced. Positive momentum and growth are expected to continue in 2026.

Original document: Melrose Industries PLC [MRO] Annual Financial Statement — Feb. 27 2026

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: FCC: Revenue up 6.9% to €9.7bn, but net profit down 62% to €164.4m on non-recurring impacts
data.description:
Revenue rose 6.9% to €9.7bn, driven by acquisitions and organic growth, while net profit fell 62% to €164.4m due to non-recurring items and currency effects. Backlog increased 11.4% to €51.6bn, with strong gains in Construction and Environmental Services.

Original document: Fomento de Construcciones y Contratas, S.A. [FCC] Interim report — Feb. 27 2026

Disclaimer
This is an AI-generated summary and may contain inaccuracies. Please verify any important information with the original source.

data.title: Business Brain Showa-Ota Inc - To Conduct 3-For-1 Share Split For Shareholders As Of March 31
data.description:
Business Brain Showa-Ota Inc :

data.title: QBEN: Major divestments and acquisitions in 2025 refocused the group on Nordic energy infrastructure
data.description:
2025 was a year of major transformation, with divestments and acquisitions refocusing the group on energy infrastructure. Net sales from continuing operations rose to 1,032 MSEK, but profitability remained negative. The group is now positioned for growth in the Nordic energy market.

Original document: Qben Infra AB [QBEN] Interim report — Feb. 27 2026

Disclaimer

data.title: Kazakhstan cafe blast, fire kill at least seven
data.description:
A blast and fire in a cafe killed at least seven people and injured 19 in Kazakhstan's northern town of Shchuchinsk, local authorities said on Friday.

A 16-year-old girl was among the casualties, with as many as 13 still in hospital, they added in a post on Instagram, but gave no further details.

data.title: ONE: Net profit rose 14% YoY to RON 425.8 million, with improved margins and strong cash flow
data.description:
Turnover remained stable at RON 1.4 billion in 2025, with net profit up 14% YoY to RON 425.8 million. Residential margins improved, rental income grew 9%, and the company maintained a strong cash position while expanding regionally and launching a major buyback program.

Original document: One United Properties S.A. [ONE] Interim report — Mar. 2 2026
